name: Fedora Server 41
install_guide_markdown:
# Fedora Server 41 Installation Guide

## Prerequisites
- 2GB RAM minimum (4GB recommended for servers)
- 20GB disk space
- Network connection for package installation
- USB drive (1GB+) for bootable media

## Step 1: Download ISO
Get DVD (offline) or netinst (online) version from fedoraproject.org

## Step 2: Create Bootable Media
Use Etcher, Rufus, or similar tool

## Step 3: Boot from USB
Restart and select USB from boot menu

## Step 4: Run Anaconda Installer
Follow installer for hostname, networking, storage, and user setup

## Step 5: Complete Installation
Reboot and access server via SSH or console

## Post-Installation
Update system: `sudo dnf upgrade`
Install additional packages as needed

install_steps.title: Download Fedora Server ISO
install_steps.detail_md: Choose DVD (2.2GB, includes packages) or netinst (700MB, downloads packages).

install_steps.title: Create Bootable Media
install_steps.detail_md:
Write ISO to USB using:
```
sudo dd if=Fedora-Server-41-x86_64.iso of=/dev/sdX bs=4M status=progress
```

install_steps.title: Boot Installer
install_steps.detail_md: Insert USB, restart, and select USB in boot menu (usually F12 or DEL).

install_steps.title: Run Anaconda Installer
install_steps.detail_md:
Select language, configure:
- Hostname
- Network settings
- Storage (automatic or custom)
- Root password
- User account

install_steps.title: Configure Networking
install_steps.detail_md:
Enable network adapters and configure IP settings:
```
sudo nmtui
```

install_steps.title: Complete Setup
install_steps.detail_md: Reboot and perform initial configuration via SSH or console.
